page.title: 14MIDDLE LYPIATT VILLAGE
page.content:
{Map Ref:-877047}
The area is a quiet peaceful place without much traffic at all only the odd car or tractor.The land is used for farming and cattle grazing or just left fallow to regenerate.There are a few farms and one is called Ferris Court Farm where we went to interview the farmer.He has beef and dairy cattle. The dairy cattle produce on average {1,659 }litres of milk a day which goes to Stroud Creamery.He owns over 300 acres of land on which the dairy and beef cattle graze.He has 60 beef and 110 dairy cattle. An interesting feature about this farm is the fact that he is breeding Fresian Bulls for beef up to 11 months old which is comparitively new and unusual.
